Name: Standing Statue of Divinity with the Head of a Serpent
Description: This statue depicts a goddess with a human torso and a cobra's head. She wears the Atef crown on her head. This crown consists of the White Crown of Upper Egypt, ram's horns, two plumes, and three uraei, or cobras, who have sun disks on top of their heads. She has human ears and is wearing a wig and a short kilt. The left hand is raised, and must have held a scepter. The leg of this statuette is broken.
